document.titleOfText: Proceedings of the International Conference on Management of Transboundary Waters
document.publisher: Ministry of Environmental Protection, Natural Resources and Forestry
document.confName: International Conference on Management of Transboundary Waters
document.subject: Water
document.keyword_fr_FR: pollution des eaux douces/qualité des eaux douces
document.keyword_es_ES: calidad de las aguas dulces/contaminación de las aguas dulces
document.keyword_fr_FR: gestion des resources en eau douce
document.abstract: Contents: Prospects for progress in the European water policy: 1. The European Community Water Framework Directive 2. Managing transboundary waters in Europe: Lessons learnt and future prospects 3. Co-operation on transboundary waters in view of Agenda 21 4. The new water policy of the European Union. Visions and facts from the point of view of the ' Länder ' of the Federal Republic of Germany 5. Effects of the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Non-Navigational Use of International Watercourses 6. Recent developments in water policy and legislation 7. Public access to information and participation in decision-making. Basic requirements for effective water management in Europe 8. Economic instruments used in water management. Co-operation on management of transboundary waters: 9. Co-operation on management of transboundary waters. The River Rhine case 10. The implementation of the Rhine Action Programme. The German experience 11. Prerequisits for effective river basin management. The case of the River Rhine 12. New institutional tools for transboundary river management in France 13. Perspectives of the environment policy in the Danube Basin 14. USAID 's Transboundary Pollution Reduction Prgramme in Hungary, Slovakia and Romania for Global Environmental Facility (GEF) / Danube River Project 15. The International Commission for the Protection of the Elbe 16. The Czech Republic and its international co-operation to protect transboundary waters 17. Development of the international co-operation in the Oder River Basin 18. Romania and its co-operation concerning the integrated management of transboundary waters 19. Convention on the Protection and Use of Transboundary Watercourses and International Lakes (1992). Activities in Latvia 20. The steps arranged by the Russian Federation for the realisation of the Convention on the Protection and Use of Transboundary Watercourses and International Lakes 21. The influence of the Convention on the Protection and Use of Transboundary Watercourses and International Lakes on the strategy for the reduction of pollution load from municipal point sources 22. The scope and goals of the Oder Project. Results of the research programmes carried out during 1994-1996 23. Poland 's co-operation with its neighbouring countries on transboundary waters 24. Co-operative Oder River Environment Project 25. Transboundary diagnostic analysis for the Dnieper River Basin 26. Transboundary water management in Central Asia. An analytical survey 27. ECE regional advisory services to facilitate the implementation of the ECE Convention on the Protection and Use of Transboundary Watercourses and International Lakes Information and basic tool in transboundary water management 28. Groundwater quality monitoring strategies 29. Information strategies. The challenge of common sense 30. Prospects for the use of indicators in water management 31. Pilot projects for monitoring and assessment of transboundary rivers under the ECE Water Convention 32. Implementation of transboundary environmental risk communication strategies: Presentation of environmental information to decision-makers and the publicc 33. Swedish-Estonian-Russian co-operation on environmental monitoring of the Estonian-Russian Lake Peipsi/Chudskoe 34. Information sharing on the environment. Problems and solutions for a network infrastructure in north-westernn Russia and the Baltic region 35. Water quality of transboundary rivers in Poland using various assessment methods 36. International Co-operative Programme on assessment and monitoring of acidification of rivers and lakes (ICP waters) 37. From data to information. Lesson learnt from the monitoring, analysis and international management activities in the Danube basin 38. Water quality monitoring at the Polish border rivers 39. Trends in riverine water quality in Poland in the period from 1992 to 1996
